summary: This document appears to be a fragment from a prison administrative record, noting an error in logbook usage for an inmate watch. It describes that a staff member named Thomas was assigned to staff watch, but the wrong log (I/M companion log) was used instead of the Staff Suicide Watch log. The error was discovered, and a second log was completed using the correct Suicide Watch log, with entries identical in both. The document includes a reference to an Associate Warden and a New York address.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Assigned to staff watch; the wrong log was initially used for his assignment, and later a correct log was completed with his initials.

persons.name: Wins
persons.context: Mentioned as 'Associate Warden WINS' in the document, associated with a New York, NY address.

connections.description: Wins is an Associate Warden, likely in a supervisory role over staff including Thomas.

events.title: Logbook error discovered and corrected
events.description: During a staff watch assignment for Thomas, the wrong logbook (I/M companion log) was used instead of the required Staff Suicide Watch log. The error was discovered, and a second, correct log was completed with identical entries.

keyFacts: A staff member named Thomas was assigned to a watch, but the wrong logbook (I/M companion log) was used instead of the Staff Suicide Watch log.
The error was discovered, and a second, correct log was completed with entries identical to the first.
An Associate Warden named Wins is referenced, with an association to New York, NY 10007.
